isis.stitle: SPLIT AIR BRAKE SYSTEM - GLOSSARY OF BRAKE TERMINOLOGY

deflist.def: The length of time required for a given amount of air to start a mechanical movement in the brake system foundation brake.
Denotes loss of vehicle brake effectiveness. Fade can be caused by mechanical deficiencies such as improperly fitted shoes, water or oil on the linings, or excessive heat.
The amount of force required to move one body while it remains in contact with another.
The actual rate at which a moving body is losing speed; expressed by number of miles per hour or feet per second.
Heat that is produced by friction during brake lining-rotor/drum contact while the vehicle is in motion (decelerating).
Referring to the fact that spring brakes are applied with some degree of control.
The time required from the operator's initial thought of stopping to the activation of the brake system.
